bill.title: Anonymous Filings; Labor and Sex Trafficking
bill.description: Allows a plaintiff to file court documents as "Jane Doe" or "John Doe" under certain circumstances in seeking an injunction in harassment cases. Requires that certain types of powers of attorney be signed by two qualified witnesses and acknowledged by a notary public. Requires challenges or contests to a will, estate plan, or trust be made within a certain time period. Makes it first degree murder to kill a witness in a family court case. Establishes the offenses of labor trafficking and sex trafficking in the first and second degree. Effective July 1, 2050. (SB77 HD1)

history.action: (S) The committee(s) on JDL has scheduled a public hearing on 03-01-11 9:00AM in conference room 016.

(S) The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Hee, Gabbard, Ihara; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Shimabukuro, Slom.
(S) Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 617) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1).
(S) Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 1 (Shimabukuro). Transmitted to House.
(H) Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 68) in amended form (SD 1).
(H) Referred to HUS, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 33
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by HUS on Monday, 03-14-11 9:00AM in House conference room 329.

(H) The committees on HUS recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Mizuno, Jordan, Hanohano, C. Lee, Morikawa, Ching, Pine; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 3 Excused: Representative(s) Belatti, Wooley, Yamane.
(H) Reported from HUS (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 973) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.
(H) Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting no (0) and Chang, Coffman, Herkes, Keith-Agaran, Nakashima, Wooley excused (6).
